citations.narrative:
On July 15th, 2024, the outdoor primary enclosure housing one Patagonian Cavy was breached, resulting in the loss of
the animal. Upon returning for evening husbandry duties, the facility representative found a hole along the front lower
corner of the enclosure’s fencing. Moderate tufts of fur were found inside the enclosure and outside the hole itself. Though
unable to confirm, the licensee and facility representative suspected a raccoon as the predator based on the size and
appearance of the hole, along with the hole's height from the ground. The Patagonian Cavy was not recovered.
Animals housed in outdoor enclosures are more vulnerable to harm from surrounding predatory animals and further injury
when enclosures fail to appropriately protect the animals. The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally
sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals.
The facility corrected prior to this inspection on July 15, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative and licensee.
